result.execSummary:
The defendant Rickey L. Henderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
3 days credit if revoked.
If revoked, Court will make a determination regarding CIP/SAP at that time.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program or Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation. 
**Pay fine of $ 2800.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. Perform 60 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization. May not have contact with Scott or Deanyelis O, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes:
**COMMENCE FORTHWITH**
Eligible for Huber on 12/27/22 and balance of time Defendant is eligible for Huber for Work Crew ONLY.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation
Virginia Hepkma

3:30 PM Defendant Rickey L. Henderson in court.  Attorney Patrick Michael Brady in court for Rickey L. Henderson.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM. DE enters guilty plea.  Court finds DE guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 3 years with conditions; 1 year jail as a condition of probation - eligible for Huber on 12/27/22 and balance of time DE is eligible for Huber for work only; credit for 3 days if revoked; DE taken into custody from court; $2800 fine plus costs including IID, DNA and $205 prosecution costs; bond applied; 36 months DL revocation; 24 months IID; if revoked, court will make a determination re: CIP/SAP at that time; OWI assessment; DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court.   Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Defendant, Rickey L. Henderson, appeared with Attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution. Not guilty plea entered.
